title: How does the therapist's communication with the creative self behind the trance affect therapy success?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author discusses the importance of communicating with the "self" behind the trance during therapy. The author believes that symptom structures are supported by Deep Trance Phenomena and clusters of trance phenomena can reveal themselves in an autonomous fashion to the observant therapist. In the last 200 words of the article, the author gives an example of an alcoholic client who spontaneously began to age regress during a session. From there, the author explains how focusing attention can either narrow or shrink it, resulting in an automatic response pattern that can lead to a non-utilization of unconscious resources.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by recognizing and understanding the power of our focus of attention and how it can create symptomatic trance states, we can open ourselves up to utilizing untapped resources within our unconscious mind. Shifting our focus of attention and interrupting the Deep Trance Phenomena can lead to regaining control and freedom from anxiety attacks.
